 21  from __future__ import division

 28 -class EarthMagneticField(ConstantVectorField): 

 29      """ 
 30      Simple model of the Earth's magnetic field. 
 31   
 32      The Earth field is modelled as a constant vector field configured by 
 33      magnitude, inclination from the horizontal and declination from true 
 34      North. 
 35      """ 
 36   

 37 -    def __init__(self, magnitude=50e-6, inclination=70, declination=0): 

 38          """ 
 39          Construct field model. 
 40   
 41          Default parameters result in a field with a magnitude of 50 
 42          microTesla, a 70 degree downwards inclination and 0 degrees 
 43          declination. These defaults are based on the nominal values for 
 44          Edinburgh, UK, with declination set to 0 degrees so that magnetic 
 45          and true North are equivalent. 
 46   
 47          @param magnitude: Magnitude of the field, in Teslas. 
 48          @param inclination: Inclination of the field to the horizontal, 
 49              in degrees. 
 50          @param declination: Delcination of the field from true North, 
 51              in degrees. 
 52          """ 
 53          theta = math.radians(declination) 
 54          ctheta = math.cos(theta) 
 55          stheta = math.sin(theta) 
 56          phi = math.radians(inclination) 
 57          cphi = math.cos(phi) 
 58          sphi = math.sin(phi) 
 59          value = magnitude * vectors.vector(cphi*ctheta, cphi*stheta, sphi) 
 60          ConstantVectorField.__init__(self, value) 

 61   

 62 -class DistortedMagneticField(VectorField): 

 63      """ 
 64      Magnetic field with distortions superimposed. 
 65      """ 
 66   

 67 -    def __init__(self, baseField, distortions=[]): 

 68          """ 
 69          Construct distorted field model. 
 70   
 71          @param baseField: The base field before distortions. 
 72          @param distortions: List of distortion fields to superimpose. 
 73          """ 
 74          self._baseField = baseField 
 75          self._distortions = distortions 

 76   

 77 -    def addDistortion(self, distortion): 

 78          self._distortions.append(distortion) 

 79   

 80 -    def __call__(self, position, t): 

 81          return sum([d(position, t) for d in self._distortions], 
 82                  self._baseField(position, t)) 

 83   
 84      @property 

 85 -    def nominalValue(self): 

 86          return self._baseField.nominalValue 

 87   

 88 -    def headingVariation(self, position, t): 

 89          """ 
 90          Calculate heading variation due to magnetic distortion. 
 91   
 92          @param position: 3xN L{np.ndarray} of position(s). 
 93   
 94          @return: Heading variation(s) in degrees at given positions. 
 95          """ 
 96          Bx,By,Bz = self(position, t) 
 97   
 98          hField = np.vstack((Bx.ravel(),By.ravel())) 
 99          hField /= vectors.norm(hField) 
100          ref = np.empty_like(hField) 
101          ref[:] = self.nominalValue[:2].copy() 
102          ref /= vectors.norm(ref) 
103          variation = np.arccos(vectors.dot(hField,ref)) 
104          return np.degrees(variation)

106 -class SolenoidMagneticField(object): 

107      """ 
108      Model of magnetic field around an ideal solenoid. 
109   
110      Follows equations from N. Derby and S. Olbert, "Cylindrical mangets and 
111      ideal solenoids", American Journal of Physics, vol 78, no. 3, pp. 229-235, 
112      March 2010. 
113      """ 

114 -    def __init__(self,n,I,a,b,transform): 

115          """ 
116          Construct solenoid field model. 
117   
118          @param n: Number of coils per unit length. 
119          @param I: Coil current. 
120          @param a: Radius of the coil 
121          @param b: Length of the solenoid. 
122          @param transform: L{AffineTransform} specifying the orientation and 
123              position of the solenoid relative to the origin of the world frame. 
124          """ 
125          self.n = n 
126          self.I = I 
127          self.a = a 
128          self.b = b/2 # b parameter of model is half the length of the solenoid 
129          self.transform = transform 

130   

131 -    def __call__(self, position, t): 

132          # Transform evaluation points so as to move solenoid to origin 
133          transformedPosition = self.transform.reverse(position) 
134          field = self.cartesianSolenoidModel(transformedPosition) 
135          # Rotate field vectors according to solenoid transform matrix 
136          return self.transform.apply(field) 

137   

138 -    def cartesianSolenoidModel(self, position): 

139          """ 
140          Compute field values of ideal solenoid given Cartesian co-ordinates. 
141   
142          @param position: 3xN L{np.ndarray} of position co-ordinates. 
143          """ 
144          x, y, z = position 
145          r,phi = cartesianToPolar(x,y) 
146          Br,Bz = self.cylindricalSolenoidModel(r,phi,z) 
147          Bx,By = polarToCartesian(Br,phi) 
148          return np.vstack((Bx,By,Bz)) 

149   

150 -    def cylindricalSolenoidModel(self,r,phi,z): 

151          """ 
152          Compute field values of ideal solenoid given cylindrical co-ordinates. 
153   
154          @param r: Radius value(s) 
155          @param phi: Angle value(s). 
156          @param z: Height value(s). 
157          """ 
158   
159          B_0 = 4*10**-7 * self.n * self.I 
160          z_plus = z+self.b 
161          z_minus = z-self.b 
162          z_plus2  = z_plus**2 
163          z_minus2 = z_minus**2 
164   
165          alpha_plus = self.a/np.sqrt(z_plus2 + (r+self.a)**2) 
166          alpha_minus = self.a/np.sqrt(z_minus2 + (r+self.a)**2) 
167          beta_plus = z_plus/np.sqrt(z_plus2 + (r+self.a)**2) 
168          beta_minus = z_minus/np.sqrt(z_minus2 + (r+self.a)**2) 
169          gamma = (self.a-r)/(self.a+r) 
170          k_plus = np.sqrt((z_plus2 + (self.a-r)**2)/(z_plus2+(self.a+r)**2)) 
171          k_minus = np.sqrt((z_minus2 + (self.a-r)**2)/(z_minus2+(self.a+r)**2)) 
172   
173          Br = B_0*(alpha_plus * _cel(k_plus,1,1,-1) - 
174                  alpha_minus*_cel(k_minus,1,1,-1)) 
175          Bz = ((B_0*self.a)/(self.a+r)) * \ 
176                  (beta_plus*_cel(k_plus,gamma**2,1,gamma) - 
177                  beta_minus*_cel(k_minus,gamma**2,1,gamma)) 
178   
179          return Br,Bz 

180   

181  @np.vectorize 
182 -def _cel(kc,p,c,s): 

183      """ 
184      Algorithm for the generalised complete elliptic integral C(k_c,p,c,s). 
185      """ 
186   
187      ERRTOL = 1e-6 
188   
189      if kc == 0: return np.nan 
190   
191      k = np.abs(kc) 
192      pp = p 
193      cc = c 
194      ss = s 
195      em = 1 
196      if p > 0: 
197          pp = np.sqrt(p) 
198          ss = s/pp 
199      else: 
200          f = kc**2 
201          q = 1-f 
202          g = 1-pp 
203          f = f-pp 
204          q = q*(ss-c*pp) 
205          pp = np.sqrt(f/g) 
206          cc = (c-ss)/g 
207          ss = -q/(g**2 * pp) + cc*pp 
208   
209      f = cc 
210      cc = cc + ss/pp 
211      g = k/pp 
212      ss = 2*(ss+f*g) 
213      pp = g+pp 
214      g = em 
215      em = k+em 
216      kk = k 
217   
218      while np.abs(g-k) > g*ERRTOL: 
219          k = 2*np.sqrt(kk) 
220          kk = k*em 
221          f = cc 
222          cc = cc + ss/pp 
223          g = kk/pp 
224          ss = 2*(ss + f*g) 
225          pp = g+pp 
226          g = em 
227          em = k+em 
228   
229      return (np.pi/2)*(ss+cc*em)/(em*(em+pp))
